title: Pachmarhi - Verdant Jewel of the Satpuras
description:
The video opens up by paying tribute to the mesmerising beauty of this enchanting place, Pachmarhi refered to as the Queen of the Satpuras. According to the Legends, the Pandvas during their exile stayed here for sometime, the video states, featuring the Pandav caves. The video then narrates about the near history, where the British discovered and developed Pachmarhi as a resort.
Several examples of British architecture are depicted in the video by featuring places like Priyadarshini (Forsyth Point), the Christ church among other churches. Apart from churches the video also showcases number of Hindu religious places like Mahadeo, Jata Shankar and the cave shelters of Dhuadhar. For nature lovers Pachmarhi is an absolute treat with its wallfalls, youthful springs and natural pools as also mentioned in the video. The video features the bathing pool of Jamuna Pratap (Bee Fall), Apsara Vihar (Fairy Pool) the perfect picnic spot and the mighty Rajat Pratap (Big Fall). Whether its the mesmerizing beauty of the Dhoopgarh (sunset point) or the majesticity of the Satpura National Park, the video presents awesome glimpses of this tourist's paradise. 
How to Reach: Nearest Airport - Bhopal (195 kms)
Nearest Rail Station - Pipariya (47 kms)
By Road - Pachmarhi is connected by regular bus services with Bhopal, Nagpur, Pipariya and Chhindwara. Taxi are also available from Pipariya.

title: Dal Bafla Ki Kahani
description:
The video tells the enthralling story about a popular delicacy of Madhya Pradesh ‚Äì Dal Bafla with a gripping 'Dal Bafla Ki Kahani'. Watch the full video to know the traditional beliefs about this age-old cuisine!

Recipe:
Ingredients: (Serves  2-3)
For the Bafla
2 cups wheat flour (300 gms)
¬Ω cup rava (100 gms)
¬Ω cup ghee
¬Ω curd 
1 tsp cumin seeds
¬º tsp ajwain
Salt to taste

For the Dal-
1 ¬Ω cups toor dal, soaked
A pinch of hing
1 tsp red chilli powder
¬Ω tsp mustard seeds
1 tsp sugar
¬Ω tsp turmeric powder
Salt to taste
1 Tbsp desi ghee
2 Tbsp coriander leaves, chopped


Method:
For the Bafla

1. In a large bowl, mix all the ingredients together to make a stiff dough, adding a little water at a time.
2. Divide the dough into smaller balls, and roll them using your palms to make them smoother.
3. Bring water to a boil in a large pan. Add salt and turmeric, and then drop the balls and cook till they float on the surface.

4. Place them on a kitchen towel to drain excess water.

5. Once they are dried, bake them in the oven at 150 degree C for till crisp and golden on both the sides.


For the Dal-

1. Pressure cook the dal in 3 ¬Ω cups of water for 3 whistles, by adding salt and turmeric powder. Let the steam escape and then add the hing and stir well. Add a little water if it is too thick, and bring to a boil.

2. Meanwhile, heat ghee in a pan, add mustard seeds and let it splutter.

3. Add red chilli powder, and quickly pour this tadka in the boiling dal. Add sugar and remove from the flame. Finish with coriander leaves.

4. To Serve


Place two Baflas on a plate, crumble them using your fingers, add a teaspoon of ghee, and pour the dal on top.

The Khajuraho Dance festival not only brings several eminent artists on the same platform but also celebrates the handicraft industry by giving local artisans a space to showcase their art pieces. Come, witness the grand celebration of culture from 20th-26th Feb in Khajuraho.

title: Chanderi Sarees | Madhya Pradesh Tourism
description:
Right from ancient times till today, Chanderi fabric is still a women's favourite must-have for her wardrobe. With a little touch of modernisation and technique, one gets to choose from an umpteen varieties of Chanderi fabric. On your visit to this quaint town, shop to your heart's content and take back this fabric as a fantastic add-on to your wardrobe collection.
